title: Making Random Number Generation a Traceable Process
author: NA
summary: Kavuri et al. propose a device-independent protocol that generates verifiable random numbers using non-local quantum correlations and traceable hash chains.

title: Sequential quantum computing: A new paradigm which divides and conquer
summary: A hybrid quantum optimization scheme combines quantum annealing and superconducting qubits to accelerate and refine solutions using counterdiabatic techniques.
author: NA

title: Certifying transmission of quantum messages in untrusted and lossy channels
summary: A new protocol by Neves et al. certifies quantum communication channels under minimal device trust, even in the presence of losses, using generalized diamond fidelity and entangled photons.
author: NA

title: A New Rydberg Scheme For Fast Entangling Gates
summary: A fast, robust Rydberg entangling gate leverages resonant dipole-dipole interactions and microwave-optimized control to outperform traditional blockade-based schemes.

title: Floquet frequency modulation for controlled arbitrary phase gates in Rydberg atom systems
summary: A Floquet-modulated Rydberg scheme enables stable two-qubit gates by overcoming anti-blockade challenges without requiring individual atom addressing.

title: Effectively describing strongly attractive 1D fermions
summary: An effective theory maps strongly attractive spin-1/2 fermions to dimers and unpaired fermions, enabling tractable solutions via perturbation.

title: Topological properties via density dependent hopping
summary: A novel model shows how interactions alone can induce topological phases in spinful fermions through density-dependent hopping.
